SEARCH
Package com.example.androidproject

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.androidproject.UserManager
public class UserManager extends Object
The purpose of this class is to facilitate interactions for a User object and the database This class helps with the signup and login functionalities. Contains the logic for following, unfollowing and followRequests. Also contains a static instance of the current logged in user: currentUser.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static UserManager getInstance(android.content.Context context)

    • getCurrentUser

      public static User getCurrentUser()
      Gets the current user
      Returns:

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String username, String password, UserManager.SignUpCallback callback)
      Creates new user and adds them to the database. If the user already exists in the database re-prompts the user to enter a different username
      Parameters:
      username - The username that is entered on signup. Unique among all other usernames
      password - The password that is entered on signup.

    • loginUser

      public void loginUser(String username, String password, UserManager.LoginCallback callback)
      Handles the login verifcation in the database. Ensures that the username and password entered match then fetches the user's data. If they do not match then it displays a toast. calls fetchCurrentUserData which populates the static currentUser object
      Parameters:
      username - the username that the user entered
      password - the password that the user entered

    • fetchCurrentUserData

      public void fetchCurrentUserData(String username)
      Fetches the user data from the database and populates the static currentUser object.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to fetch.

    • fetchOtherUserData

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> fetchOtherUserData(String username)
      Fetches the other user data from the database and returns a populated user object.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the otherUser to fetch.

    • sendFollowRequest

      public void sendFollowRequest(String senderUsername, String receiverUsername)
      Sends a follow request to a user in the database
      Parameters:
      senderUsername - the user who is sending the follow request
      receiverUsername - the user who is receiving the database

    • acceptFollowRequest

      public void acceptFollowRequest(String acceptorUsername, String requesterUsername)
      A function to handle accepting a follow request in firebase. Called in the FollowRequestAdapter when the accept button is pressed. It adds the acceptor to requestors following list and requester to acceptors followers list
      Parameters:
      acceptorUsername - the username of the current logged in user who is accepting the follow request
      requesterUsername - the user name who is being rejected. This is the name that is removed from rejectorUsernames followRequest list in firebase.

    • unfollowUser

      public void unfollowUser(String currentUsername, String userToBeUnfollowed)
      A function to unfollow a user in the database. Can also be used to remove a follower by swapping the order of the arguments
      Parameters:
      currentUsername - The user that wishes to unfollow another user
      userToBeUnfollowed - The user that is being unfollowed

    • rejectFollowRequest

      public void rejectFollowRequest(String rejectorUsername, String requesterUsername)
      A function to handle deleting a follow request from firebase. Called in the FollowRequestAdapter when the reject button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      rejectorUsername - the username of the current logged in user.
      requesterUsername - the user name who is being rejected. This is the name that is removed from rejectorUsernames followRequest list in firebase.

    • cancelFollowRequest

      public void cancelFollowRequest(String cancelerUsername, String receiverUsername)
      A function to handle revoking a follow request from firebase. Called in OtherProfileActivity when the follow button is pressed when it says "requested".
      Parameters:
      cancelerUsername - the username of the current logged in user that is revoking their follow request
      receiverUsername - the user who's followRequest list is being changed to not have the cancelerUsername in it.
